sentences.sentence: So the Woodcutter( 伐木工 ) and his wife went out and called to the Star-Child, and said to him, “Go into the house, and there you will find your mother waiting for you.”
The Star-Child ran in to the house, filled with( 充满 ) wonder and great joy( 喜悦 ).
But when he saw who she was, he laughed cruelly( 残酷地 ) and said, “Where is my mother? I see no one here but this disgusting( 令人厌恶的 ) beggar-woman( 女乞丐 ).”
And the woman answered him, “I am your mother.”
“You are mad to say so,” cried the Star-Child angrily.
“I am no son of yours, because you are a beggar( 乞丐 ), and ugly, and your clothes are torn( 破烂的 ) and dirty.
Therefore get away from here, and do not let me see your ugly face again.”
“No, you are in fact my little son, whom I took out into the forest,” she cried.
She fell on her knees, and held out her arms to him.
“The robbers( 盗贼 ) stole you from me, and left you to die,” she said,
“but I recognized( 认出 ) you when I saw you.
I also recognized( 认出 ), the golden fabric( 布料 ) and the amber( 琥珀 ) necklace( 项链 ).
Therefore I beg( 恳求 ) you to come with me, because I have wandered( 流浪 ) in search of( 寻找 ) you over the whole world.
Come with me, my son, for I need your love.”
But the Star-Child did not move from where he stood, and closed his heart to her.
He did not hear anything she said, but heard only the sound of the woman crying in pain.
And at last he spoke to her, and his voice was hard and bitter( 充满怨恨的 ).
“If you are truly my mother,” he said, “then it would have been better for you to have stayed away.
I wish you had not come here to bring me shame, because I once thought I was the child of some star, and not a beggar( 乞丐 )’s child.
Therefore get away from here, and do not let me see you again.”
“My son!” she cried.
“Will you kiss me before I go? I have suffered( 受罪 ) much to find you.”
“No,” said the Star-Child, “You are too ugly to look at, and I would rather kiss a snake or a toad( 癞蛤蟆 ) than you.”
So the woman stood up, and went away into the forest crying bitterly( 伤心地 ).
When the Star-Child saw that she was gone, he was glad, and ran back to his friends to play with them.
But when they saw him coming, they laughed at him and said, “You are as ugly as a toad( 癞蛤蟆 ), and as disgusting( 令人厌恶的 ) as a snake.
Get away from us, for we do not want to play with you.”
And after saying this they chased( 驱逐 ) him out of the garden.
The Star-Child frowned( 皱眉 ) and said to himself,
“What did they say to me? A toad( 癞蛤蟆 )! A snake! I will go to the lake and look at my reflection( 倒影 ).
It will show me how beautiful I am.”
So he went to the lake and looked into it, and saw his face was as ugly as that of a toad( 癞蛤蟆 ), and his body was as disgusting( 令人厌恶的 ) as that of a snake.
He fell down on the grass and cried, and said to himself,
“Surely this has happened to me as punishment, because I have driven my mother away, and been too proud, and cruel( 残忍的 ) to her.
Therefore, I will wander( 流浪 ) over the whole world searching for her, and will not rest until I find her.”
And then the little daughter of the Woodcutter( 伐木工 ) came to him, and she put her hand on his shoulder, and said,
“What does it matter if you have lost your beauty? Stay with us, and I will not laugh at you.”
And he said to her, “No, I have been cruel( 残忍的 ) to my mother, and as punishment I have been made ugly.
Therefore, I must leave this place, and wander( 流浪 ) over the whole world until I find her, and seek( 寻求 ) her forgiveness( 原谅 ).”
So he ran away into the forest and called out to his mother to come to him, but there was no answer.
All day long he called to her.
When the sun set he lay down to sleep on a bed of leaves, and the birds and the animals ran away from him, because they remembered his cruelty( 残忍 ).
He was alone except for a toad( 癞蛤蟆 ) that watched him, and a snake that passed by( 经过 ) slowly.

question.cn: 当星孩得知“女乞丐”是他的母亲后，他做了什么？
question.en: What did the Star-Child do when he knew that the beggar-woman was his mother?

options.en: He told his mother to go away.
He gave his mother a hug.

analysis: 文中星孩得知真相之后说“I am no son of yours, because you are a beggar, and ugly, and your clothes are torn and dirty. Therefore get away from here, and do not let me see your ugly face again.”因此本题选B。

question.cn: 为什么其他孩子都不愿意和星孩一起玩耍了？
question.en: Why did the kids refuse to play with the Star-Child?

options.cn: 因为他们知道他不善良。
options.en: Because they knew that he was not kind.

options.cn: 因为他们发现他是乞丐的孩子。
options.en: Because they found that he was the son of a beggar.
Because the Star-Child became very ugly.

analysis: 文中其他小孩对星孩说“You are as ugly as a toad, and as disgusting as a snake. Get away from us, for we do not want to play with you.”可知因为星孩变丑了，小伙伴们都不愿和他玩耍，因此本题选C。

question.cn: 星孩在得知自己变丑之后决定做什么？
question.en: What did the Star-Child decide to do when he knew that he was ugly?

options.cn: 他决定跟伐木工待在一起。
options.en: He decided to stay with the Woodcutter.
He decided to find his mother.

analysis: 文中提到，“ ‘No, I have been cruel to my mother, and as punishment I have been made ugly. Therefore, I must leave this place, and wander over the whole world until I find her, and seek her forgiveness.’ So he ran away into the forest and called out to his mother to come to him, but there was no answer. ”因此本题选B。

question.en: Why did the animals run away from the Star-Child?

options.cn: 因为他是一个乞丐的孩子。

options.cn: 因为他曾对它们很残忍。
options.en: Because he was cruel to them.
